Card producers need a way to carefully manage this "token economy" to sell their inventory while still not devaluing it.

Central banks is like the One Ring in Tolkien's fantasy. 

Everyone succumbs to it, regardless of them being a hero in their early life.

profile_bio.description:

tweets.text:
@BoringBiz_ You assume a "carry risk" people don't talk about. 

The returns you get is based on the risk that: 
- cards get damaged
- future demand increases
- future supply is controlled very well by Pokemon Inc
- you can liquidate it at spot at no discount

If its that profitable every store keeper would have hoarded.

tweets.text:
There is no other platform outside of Twitter that talks about, or allows the dialogue about the rate of reproduction, dependency ratio, or demographic related topics. 

You are automatically assumed to be sexist, political, or commercially risky person when you try it.

profile_bio.description:
Software engineer. ex-quant.

All relevant links on the website.

quoted_tweet.text:
I'm not used to being SHOCKED by something every single day, but EVERY SINGLE DAY, I am shocked to my bones that the replacement of our population is not the only thing that any of us are talking about, ever, at any time. I would switch my whole entire channel over to being about that and nothing else if I thought it would work.

If you're not red-alert-level aware of how serious this problem is, it's like having your home broken into by 20 thugs and just sitting at the computer and asking if they want to see memes while they kill your kids.

I understand why self-hating libroaches aren't taking it seriously (they either want to die or are fantasizing that the invaders will treat them well), but anyone else should be all-in on "this must be reversed and those responsible must be punished in a famous manner that will unsettle generations to come."

You guys know that entire states are about to be devoid of Americans, right? You know that there are no French people in Paris and no British in London, right?

At what point do people realize "this is not going to stop before it gets to my neighborhood?" What does it take to make them feel personally affected?
